author: jondepinet
title: Lobbying for favorable legislation
description: How can Cardano, and blockchain more broadly advance our interests into favorable legislation for the future of the industry and humanity?

f6_assessments.q0: If we want Cardano to be the social and financial operating system that will allow us to build alternatives to traditional financial services, we have to become masters in how to approach this topic. To me, it's that simple. So I agree that it aligns with and is critical to Cardano's mission. Considering that should this challenge be selected for Fund 9 it would be the third cycle in a row I would have liked to see an update on the challenge setting in terms of directions to follow for proposers and major signs of impact that the proposals that have already been funded are having. In evaluating this challenge versus the strategic goals for the next fund it is clear that one of the goals has been met, so I recommend to the team that for future funds they have made efforts to improve the wording of the challenge settings in order to align with at least one more goal. My score is 5.
f6_assessments.q1: The challenge team is requesting a 67% increase in the allocated budget, despite the fact that last challenge we only had 18 proposals of which 7 were selected for funding, which initially seemed to be a poor response from the community and would not justify the budget increase. However, for Fund 8 we see an increase not only in the number of proposals with a total of 24 competing proposals (34%) but also a considerable increase in the amount of budget requested with a total of $849,127 which represents an increase of 300% versus the amount requested in the previous fund, of course the amounts still need to be validated by the community in the QA phase but we notice a greater interest not only in the capacity but in the interest of the community to address this challenge. Based on my analysis above, I have decided to assign a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q2: The challenge team does a great job articulating the success criteria, I liked the new approach given to the description in the previous background. Now, considering the characteristics of this challenge and after analyzing the set of five suggested metrics I find that most of them are very difficult to measure as it is a multifactorial and subjective topic. So I would recommend to the team that based on the lessons learned in the last two funds, these metrics could be updated as it seems to be very difficult to prove that the progress of these metrics is due precisely to the success of a proposal funded through Catalyst. Therefore, based on the justification previously stated, I give a score of 3.

f6_assessments.q0:
One of the major obstacles that delay the adoption of cryptocurrencies by more people is the existence of harmful regulation by several governments and jurisdictions. In several countries there are laws aimed at suppressing or prohibiting the use of cryptocurrencies. Recently China banned Bitcoin miners from the country and this caused a huge migration of miners to other countries. We are living in a time of regulatory crackdown, where governments are creating increasingly restrictive laws and this ends up suppressing the potential for using cryptocurrencies in general. This challenge proposes to make room for solutions that press for favorable legislation, so I see it as essential for Cardano's mission.

This challenge is also in line with the Catalyst Fund9 Challenge Setting Strategic Goals, more precisely item 3 (Accelerate the growth and evolution of developer & app ecosystem), as favorable regulation would allow greater access and ease of use of cryptocurrencies.
f6_assessments.q1:
Creating favorable legislation is not an easy task, as it involves political interests that in many cases involve political and financial conflicts of interest, which can hamper the feasibility or efficiency of the proposals developed in this challenge.

This challenge doesn't bring technical relevant technical challenges, the difficulty in this case is in negotiating and educating government representatives on the importance of favorable legislation, therefore it depends directly on the expertise of the proposers in areas such as law, policy and legislation. Taking into account the demand of the challenge in the last two Funds, it is noticeable who the community has shown interest. 

There is already a challenge team (since Fund 7) defined for this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: There are good and relevant key metrics for evaluating the performance of proposals that may eventually be created in this challenge. The definition of success is reasonable but could be more objective, with clearer and more tangible goals.

f6_assessments.q0: Creating regulation around Cardano creates a space accessible to global adaptation. By creating a challenge that focuses on the legislation you create a place where we are able to construct our path forward which accelerates the growth of the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: For feasibility, I would've had some concerns if this was the first time proposing such a challenge, because of the niche market this appeals to. But since this is a recurring challenge setting where we are able to see how the community addresses this challenge I have confidence in the challenge settings. However, I believe the 300.000 in ADA we have right now is more than enough for a challenge like this.
f6_assessments.q2: Looking at the success and key metrics I see they haven't changed with the current challenge which are still the correct metrics to measure the progress. My only uneasiness with these metrics is how will they be measured by the community. How sure can we be a law is changed because of a proposal that is funded. Legislation is a hard topic which makes the key metrics even harder. Maybe we should re-write them a bit so they have a clearer view.

f6_assessments.q0:
This challenge has already been set in Catalyst Fund 8 with a 300k USD budget and the challenge is proposed again for Fund 9 with an increased 500k budget.
Getting a favorable legislation as never been more critical for blockchain in general and for Cardano in particular. Following russian attack on ukrain it has been shown that Crypto assets are used to get around international sanctions, which is a threat for regulation of crypto in western countries.
I remove 1 star as I consider we should first assess the impact of this challenge in Fund 7 before to set it again, improved by experience of Fund 7
f6_assessments.q1: The community has made 24 proposals for this challenge in Fund 7. It is not a large number and they are not all good quality proposals. Considering this I neither agree nor disagree that the community has the capacity to address this challenge. I recommend resubmitting this challenge proposal in Fund 10.
f6_assessments.q2: Several key metrics are defined to enable the community to track the progress of this challenge. Most of them are unprecise, ambitious and hard to measure effectively: number of laws that have been modified, votes of politicians engaged. Based on this brief I disagree that the community will be able to track the effect of the proposals in this challenge. I recommend the challenge team to work on lower level kpi that would be easier to measure (number of publication / views of article or media in favor of a favorable legislation for example ?)

f6_assessments.q0: As with any new technology, ensuring policy and regulation do not stifle its development but rather promote its adoption and safety is as vital to the survival of said technology as is the development of the technical aspect itself. Therefore, keeping this Challenge in Fund9 will aid Cardano startups to not be harassed or impeded from doing their important work, by simultaneously incentivizing the legal and legislative work necessary for promoting PoS- and Cardano-friendly regulatory frameworks in several regions and countries.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have a history of engagement with the Cardano Community, and have already carried out this Challenge in Funds 7 and 8, counting therefore with a consolidated team that will be able to guide and provide support to projects presented within the Challenge setting, using the lessons learned from previous iterations to improve upon the new ones.
f6_assessments.q2: As regulations and policies are matters of public record, it is relatively easy to measure the concrete progress of this Challenge, albeit the actual effectiveness of the lobbying efforts themselves are difficult to measure before being put to the test of an actual vote on an actual piece of draft leigslation. The proposed KPIs (number of jurisdictions favored through lobbying, number of laws that have been modified, number of experts in regulation, lawyers, and other members involved, number of partnerships and collaborations with organizations and non-profits that work in the same cause, number of votes of politicians engaged, etc.) are consistent with the goals of the Challenge, although it would be interesting for future iterations to analyze whether or not a regional or country division of the proposals within the Challenge could aid in a more effective assessment of the follow-up potential of funded proposals.

importance: Government Regulation can either be the greatest ally or the greatest enemy of Blockchain, they must have the best guidance possible.
success: Success would be measured in legislation advanced or defeated; public and political opinion; and legislation proposed in favor of Cardano.
